description:
It has a lot of pros. It's free, and it plays videos without lagging. I had VLC before, and it plays 1080p very poorly. In this player however, that is not the case. It also has good controls. It can screenshot fast, too!

Here are the cons that I noticed:

It doesn't have the best design, so they can work on that. However, it is a free software, so, we cannot complain about it. However, if the developers are willing to redesign, they can get inspo from QuickPlayer!

When I screenshot using the shortcut "S," the quality is lowered down.

Those are it, really.

I would like the app to have a function wherein you can select multiple subtitles at once, since some of the things I watch have multiple subs (mostly anime).
summary: Superb app, but can improve more to be the best

description: This is my favorite media player always, play any media file with no any issues
Does everything...

This is the go to for linux users that used Windows OS and MPC Home Cinema video players.

You will have to mess with the settings in preferences to get it just right, but well worth it IMHO.
summary: the media player classic alternative for linux

description: i propose this to you
I'm using it as my default player for all medias.
summary: Its the best app... Thank you !

description: Great because it was at the top of the list of apps, in installed very easy and worked as advertised. No mus, no fuss, just worked

Granted it is a front end, but it allows easy access to features I would never be able to remember for the cli of either mplayer or mpv.

Among those I most enjoy: comprehensive queue options including entire directories; multiple instances with negligible-to-imperceptible resource penalty; detailed control of where to send audio and video; superbly configurable thumbnail generator; highly granular playback control; and playback position-and-settings memory across sessions.

Perhaps best of all, no functional access is 'dumbed down' to prevent 'mere users' from using whatever controls the application(s) possess. 

As for the interface, I'm looking at the video, not the application playing it, nor do I break out in hives when an application that runs on anything fails to adhere to the last pixel of any particular desktop environment.

Finally, I have yet to find a video that SMPlayer cannot handle with aplomb.
summary: Flexible, Robust, Fine Granular Control, Plays Anything

description: I had used VLC before but when I forward and rewind, it's lag between audio and pictures. But with SMPlayer, it's not.
qqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqq

Launches very quickly, much quicker than VLC. Remembers all your files and settings for each file. Love the features. Easy to use and set up your preferences. Sound is very good for mp3's. I downloaded this as I was having problems with the standard video player that comes with the Ubuntu install. It locked up regularly and sometimes wouldn't display older video formats properly. Sometimes it would, sometimes it wouldn't. It had a mind of it's own. VLC is good but launches slower and it too can sometimes lock up on me and do weird things, even on my new, very fast desktop.

I should have downloaded this player sooner. No complaints from me so far.
summary: I really like this player - now my default player for videos

description: Superior to current version of VLC - 1080p videos playback is without any laggs, even minimizing/maximizing does not make the playback stop

This application will play most videos without loss or lag, but it will not play Movie DVDs and will display Error: Code 2 in the attempt. These are movies made by such as Paramount, MGM, Warner Bros., etc etc. It should be noted in the description that although it will play DVDs in general, such as clips and user recorded video, that it will not play commercial DVDs. Otherwise a very good application.
summary: This app is adequate, good to very good for Freeware

description: corrupted me media file. cannot play it anymore

I've been using SMPlayer for 10+ years now, and thought it was about to write a review about the best video player I've used.

This player is easy to use, but still packed with tons of features that allow you to adjust every detail of the video. Some of the features that make this player a must for me are: 
 - Lookup of subtitles for any video in multiple languages
 - Synchronise subtitles if they're not a perfect fit for your video. This task is rather manual, but necessary if the only subtitles that you have are out of sync
 - Youtube player. Just load a URL for a video or playlist, and you'll have all the nice features of this player

It packs millions of extra features, from the ones I use rarely to some others that are really cool but not fit to my specific usage, but in any case you should give a try to SMPlayer, I'm sure you won't get dissapointed.
summary: Easy to use with unique features

description:
Awesome !! Almost Everything is available here.
Foe me : We can load an external audio ( useful for seeing movies in another language)
Three things that are important to me in an app and thats 1. Does It Crash, is it reliable. 2. Appearance is it good on the eyes. 3. Features the many options at your disposal. Keep up the good work.

I was using Totem since it came pre-installed with Ubuntu 20.04 and was disappointed to see how it had been handled and how uncustomizable it was. And the way it handled subtitles was absolutely egregious considering I watch a lot of foreign media.

I tried VLC but it was not able to read encoded subtitles on a video file. I have never had this problem before and yet here it was happening. I tried MPV but the Snap version of it is useless. SMPlayer here, however, not only provided just the right amount of customization, but it also worked perfectly with my anime. So, yeah, it just works. Really cool.
summary: Worked for me when VLC & MPV couldn't

Depuis le passage de Mplayer à MPV, le lecteur a gagné en efficacité. L'accélération matérielle soulage de beaucoup l'utilisation CPU. Les nombreuses préférences rendent le lecteur efficient et pratique à l'usage. SMPlayer est donc bien plus qu'un simple fontend à MPlayer/MPV.
sobre... : excellent
Je l'ai testé sous toutes ses coutures et je le trouve simple à paramétrer, conviviale, très cool à l'usage.

donc là, Génial

Codecs intégrés comme pour VLC donc pas besoin de chercher.
Possibilité de régler les raccourcis claviers pour chaque action
Possibilité de régler 3 sauts dans le temps différents et de choisir leur durée.
Le seul reproche que je peux vraiment lui faire, on ne peut pas choisir où enregistrer l'historique de la lecture vidéo, donc impossible de la partager entre plusieurs PC pour reprendre là où on s'était arrêter sur le fichier vidéo.
Il m'arrive d'utiliser ce logiciel pour le mkv que je n'arrive pas à lire avec VLC. Je l'ai essayé pour pour d'autres vidéos et il est très bon. Malgré cela, je reste fan de VLC.
